intro: Didymopanax micranthus, commonly known as the small-leaved sycoglossum, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically pinnate with small, ovate leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by berries that mature to a reddish color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
